title: Identifying Reciprocals
text: Notice the second and third terms are reciprocals: $$0.25=\frac{1}{4}$$ which is a reciprocal of $$4$$ thus they cancel out to $$1$$ when multiplied.
speech: Notice the second and third terms are reciprocals:  0.25 is equal to, 1 fourth  which is a reciprocal of  4  thus they cancel out to  1  when multiplied.
pacedSpeech: Notice the second and third terms are reciprocals:   0.25 is equal to, 1 fourth

title: Simplifying the Expression
text: Multiply the resulting expression from left to right. What is the simplified expression?
speech: Multiply the resulting expression from left to right. What is the simplified expression?
pacedSpeech: Multiply the resulting expression from left to right. What is the simplified expression?
